title: Client Report - Environment on Growth
text:
Show the code
import pandas as pd
from palmerpenguins import load_penguins
from lets_plot import *

LetsPlot.setup_html()

title: Client Report - Environment on Growth
text:
Elevator pitch
The antartic environment of the Biscoe island has caused the penguins from Biscoe to be materially larger than the penguins from Torgensen and Dream.


Read and format project data
# Learn morea about Code Cells: https://quarto.org/docs/reference/cells/cells-jupyter.html

df = pd.read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/byuidatascience/data4python4ds/master/data-raw/mpg/mpg.csv")


Highlight the Questions and Tasks The penguins on Biscoe were signifigantly larger than the penguins from Tergensen and Dream.

title: Client Report - Environment on Growth
text:
Question|Task 1
Recreate the example chart from PY4DS: CH2 Data Visualization of the textbook.
The freezing temperatures of the artic environment on Briscoe island has forced the Penguins to grow larger to produce enough heat and hunt enough to survive their harsh environment. Briscoe island enabled and forced the penguins to develop the largest flippers and have the largest body mass in order to adapt.


Compares the flipper length and body of penguins from different islands.
# Include and execute your code here

# Load the penguins dataset
penguins = load_penguins()

LetsPlot.setup_html()
(ggplot(
  data = penguins,
  mapping = aes(x = "flipper_length_mm", y = "body_mass_g", color = "island")
) +
### Body mass and flipper length are compared variables, Island of origin is plotted to find relationship between environment and size.
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(se = False))



            
            
            
Environment and growth

title: Client Report - Environment on Growth
text:
Question|Task 2
Include the table created from PY4DS: CH2 Data Visualization used to create the above chart.
Below is the raw data that the chart above was produced from.


Islands, Flipper, Body Mass
# Include and execute your code here
    
import pandas as pd
from palmerpenguins import load_penguins
penguins = load_penguins()
demonstrate = ['island', 'flipper_length_mm', 'body_mass_g']

print(penguins)

title: Client Report - Introduction
text:
Elevator pitch
A SHORT (2-3 SENTENCES) PARAGRAPH THAT DESCRIBES KEY INSIGHTS TAKEN FROM METRICS IN THE PROJECT RESULTS THINK TOP OR MOST IMPORTANT RESULTS. (Note: this is not a summary of the project, but a summary of the results.)
A Client has requested this analysis and this is your one shot of what you would say to your boss in a 2 min elevator ride before he takes your report and hands it to the client.


Read and format project data
# Learn morea about Code Cells: https://quarto.org/docs/reference/cells/cells-jupyter.html

# Include and execute your code here
df = pd.read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/byuidatascience/data4python4ds/master/data-raw/mpg/mpg.csv")


Highlight the Questions and Tasks

title: Client Report - Introduction
text:
Question|Task 1
COPY PASTE QUESTION|TASK 1 FROM THE PROJECT HERE
Add details here to answer the question but NOT like an assignment Q&A. You need to write your answers as a consulting solution report. A Client needs to understand the answer, but also needs to understand the decisions that went into the answer (when applicable).
include figures in chunks and discuss your findings in the figure.

YOU SHOULD HAVE QUALITY WRITING THAT DESCRIBES YOUR CHARTS AND TABLES.
WE HIGHLY RECOMMEND GRAMMARLY TO FIX YOUR SPELLING AND GRAMMAR. WRITING TAKES TIME TO BE CLEAR. SPEND THE TIME TO PRACITCE.
YOU SHOULD HAVE QUALITY COMMENTS THAT DESCRIBES YOUR CODES. OFTEN CODEERS WORK IN TEAMS AND YOU NEED TO HAVE QUALTIY COMMENTS FOR YOUR TEAM AND YOURSELF. YOU MAY NEED TO REVISIT CODE YOU WROTE OVER A YEAR AGO, AND IF YOU DONT COMMENT IT NOW YOU WONT REMEMBER WHY YOU DID WHAT YOU DID.

title: Client Report - Introduction
text:
Question|Task 3
COPY PASTE QUESTION|TASK 3 FROM THE PROJECT HERE

PROVIDE TABLES THAT HELP ADDRESS THE QUESTIONS AND TASKS (IF APPLICABLE).



table example
# Include and execute your code here
mydat = (df.head(1000)
    .groupby('manufacturer')
    .sum()
    .reset_index()
    .tail(10)
    .filter(["manufacturer","displ","cty", "hwy"])
)

display(mydat)
